00029 /// Log class.
00030 /// The log facility used by the framework and available for use by the
00031 /// applications.
00032 /// @class Log
00033 
00034 /// File pointer of the Log file
00035 /// @private @memberof Log
00036 static FILE* fpLog;
00037 
00038 /// Maximum size of the name of the Log file
00039 /// @private @memberof Log
00040 enum LogNameSize
00041 {
00042    LOGNAMESIZE = 256
00043 };
00044 
00045 /// Maximum size of the name of the Log directory
00046 /// @private @memberof Log
00047 enum
00048 {
00049    LOGDIRSIZE = 256
00050 };
00051 
00052 /// Log file directory
00053 /// @private @memberof Log
00054 static char logDir[LOGDIRSIZE] = ".";
00055 
00056 /// Log file name
00057 /// @private @memberof Log
00058 static char logName[LOGNAMESIZE];
00059 
00060 /// Contention mutex, because the Log functions can be called from any Thread
00061 /// @private @memberof Log
00062 static mutex_t* logMutex;
00063 
00064 /// Identification of this source file for Log purposes
00065 /// @private @memberof Log
00066 static cchar sourceID[] = "ZLO";
00067 
00068 /// Current function name
00069 /// @private @memberof Log
00070 static cchar* funcName;
00071 
00072 /// Current Log level.
00073 /// By default, write everything to the log, except debug info.
00074 /// @private @memberof Log
00075 static uint currentLogLevel = LOG_LEVEL_INFO;
00076 
00077 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00078 
00079 // layout of a line that is written to the log file
00080 //
00081 // pos  len content
00082 // 00   06  HHMMSS time
00083 // 06   01  space 1
00084 // 07   01  level    "I" for info, "W" for warning, "E" for error
00085 // 08   01  space 2
00086 // 09   03  sourceID
00087 // 12   01  space 3
00088 // 13   04  lineNum  source line number where the log function was called
00089 // 17   01  space 4
00090 // 18   03   thread seq no
00091 // 21   01  space 5
00092 // 22   xx  additional data
00093 
00094 /// Offsets in the Log line layout
00095 /// @private @memberof Log
00096 enum LogLineLayout
00097 {
00098    LOG_OFF_TIME   = 0  , LOG_OFF_SPC1 = 6  ,
00099    LOG_OFF_LEVEL  = 7  , LOG_OFF_SPC2 = 8  ,
00100    LOG_OFF_SRC_ID = 9  , LOG_OFF_SPC3 = 12 ,
00101    LOG_OFF_LINE   = 13 , LOG_OFF_SPC4 = 17 ,
00102    LOG_OFF_THRD   = 18 , LOG_OFF_SPC5 = 21 ,
00103    LOG_OFF_DATA   = 22
00104 };
00105 
00106 /// Length of Log line buffer
00107 /// @private @memberof Log
00108 enum LogBufferLength
00109 {
00110    LOG_BUF_LEN = 256
00111 };
00112 
00113 /// Maximum length of data in the Log line buffer
00114 /// @private @memberof Log
00115 enum MaximumLogDataLength
00116 {
00117    LOG_DATA_LEN = (LOG_BUF_LEN - LOG_OFF_DATA - 1)
00118 };
00119 
00120 /// The Log line buffer
00121 /// @private @memberof Log
00122 static char logBuf[LOG_BUF_LEN];
00123 
00124 // internal helper functions
00125 /// @cond hides_from_doxygen
00126 static void createLogName(void);
00127 static char hiHex(char);
00128 static char levelChar(uint);
00129 static char loHex(char);
00130 static void nullLog(cchar* fmt, ...) { fmt = 0; }
00131 static FormatFunc writeCommonHeader(cchar*, int, uint);
00132 static void writeTraceTitle(cchar*, int, cchar*, uint);
00133 /// @endcond

00135 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00136 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00137 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00138 
00139 /** Finishes writing a Log line.
00140 
00141     @param [in]
00142     format : printf-like fomat specification.
00143 
00144     @memberof Log
00145 */
00146 
00147 TC2API void log_body(cchar* format, ...)
00148 {
00149    va_list parms;
00150    int bufLen = LOG_DATA_LEN;
00151    int funcLen = 0;
00152 
00153    assert(format);
00154 
00155    if (funcName)
00156    {
00157       funcLen = strlen(funcName) + 3; // +3 for open/close parms and space
00158       sprintf(logBuf+LOG_OFF_DATA,"(%s) ", funcName);
00159       bufLen -= funcLen;
00160    }
00161 
00162    va_start(parms, format);
00163    vsnprintf(logBuf+LOG_OFF_DATA+funcLen, bufLen, format, parms);
00164    va_end(parms);
00165 
00166    fputs(logBuf, fpLog);
00167    fputc('\n', fpLog);
00168    fflush(fpLog);
00169 
00170    // see lock call in log_header function
00171    mutex_unlock(logMutex);
00172 }
00173 
00174 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00175 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00176 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00177 
00178 /** Starts writing a log line.
00179 
00180     @param [in]
00181     _funcName : name of the function that is writing this line, or NULL
00182 
00183     @param [in]
00184     _sourceID : 3-chars string identifying the current source file
00185 
00186     @param [in]
00187     lineNum : line number in the source file where this function was called
00188 
00189     @param [in]
00190     level : severity of the Log record, see Log.h.
00191 
00192     @memberof Log
00193 */
00194 
00195 TC2API FormatFunc log_fheader(cchar* _funcName, cchar* _sourceID, int lineNum,
00196    uint level)
00197 {
00198    // checks to see if the log facility is not initialized
00199    if (!fpLog)
00200       log_init();
00201 
00202    // doesn't write if severity not allowed (bigger level is less severity)
00203    if (level > currentLogLevel)
00204       return nullLog;
00205 
00206    assert(_sourceID);
00207    assert(_funcName);
00208 
00209    mutex_lock(logMutex); // see unlock in log_body function
00210 
00211    funcName = _funcName;
00212 
00213    return writeCommonHeader(_sourceID, lineNum, level);
00214 }
00215

00218 /** Retrieves the current log level.
00219 
00220     @return
00221     the current log level
00222 
00223     @memberof Log
00224 */
00225 
00226 TC2API uint log_level(void)
00227 {
00228    return currentLogLevel;
00229 }

00235 /** Writes an hexadecimal trace in the Log file.
00236 
00237     @param [in]
00238     _sourceID : 3-chars string identifying the current source file
00239 
00240     @param [in]
00241     lineNum : line number in the source file where this function was called
00242 
00243     @param [in]
00244     msg : message identifying the hex dump
00245 
00246     @param [in]
00247     buf : address of the buffer from which to write the hex dump
00248 
00249     @param [in]
00250     bufLen : number of bytes of source buffer
00251 
00252     @memberof Log
00253 */
00254 
00255 TC2API void log_writeTrace(cchar* _sourceID, int lineNum, cchar* msg, cchar* buf,
00256    uint bufLen)
00257 {
00258    cchar* pBuf = buf; // pointer runs over the data buffer
00259 
00260    // dump line specification
00261    int offset = 0;                     // initial offset
00262    int offSize = 4;                    // length of offset when formatted
00263    int nBlocks = 6;                    // number of blocks per line
00264    int blockBytes = 4;                 // number of byter per block
00265    int bufStep = nBlocks*blockBytes;   // increment to add for the next line
00266    int nLines = bufLen / bufStep;      // number of complete lines
00267    int lastStep = bufLen % bufStep;    // length of residual last line
00268 
00269    // off  1(4byt)  2        3        4        5        6        24 bytes
00270    // xxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
00271 
00272    // boilerplate code
00273    if (!fpLog)
00274       log_init();
00275    assert(_sourceID);
00276    mutex_lock(logMutex);
00277 
00278    writeTraceTitle(_sourceID, lineNum, msg, bufLen); 
00279 
00280    // now loops over the lines
00281    for (;;)
00282    {
00283       uchar* pCurBuf; // uchar, or else problems with sign extension!
00284       char* pLogBuf = logBuf + LOG_OFF_DATA;
00285       int i, stepLen, savStepLen;
00286 
00287       if (nLines--)           // still one full line to go ?
00288          stepLen = bufStep;   // ok, full step then
00289       else if (lastStep)      // last (partial) line to go ?
00290          stepLen = lastStep;  // uses last step
00291       else                    // else done,
00292          break;               // breaks out of loop
00293       savStepLen = stepLen;
00294 
00295       writeCommonHeader(_sourceID, lineNum, LOG_LEVEL_TRACE);
00296       sprintf(pLogBuf, "%0*X ", offSize, offset);  // writes offset
00297       offset += bufStep;  // prepares offset for next line
00298       pLogBuf += offSize; // advances log buffer
00299 
00300       // now loops over the blocks
00301       pCurBuf = (uchar*)pBuf;
00302       for (i = 0; i < nBlocks; i++) // a block
00303       {
00304          int j;
00305          *pLogBuf++ = ' '; // writes separator
00306          // now, writes 1 block
00307          for (j = 0; j < blockBytes; j++)
00308              if (stepLen) // are there still bytes to write ?
00309              {
00310                 *pLogBuf++ = hiHex(*pCurBuf);
00311                 *pLogBuf++ = loHex(*pCurBuf);
00312                 pCurBuf++, stepLen--;
00313              }
00314              else
00315                 *pLogBuf++ = ' ', *pLogBuf++ = ' ';
00316       } // a block
00317 
00318       // now writes the plain bytes
00319       *pLogBuf++ = ' '; // last separator
00320       pCurBuf = (uchar*)pBuf;   // resets the current data pointer
00321       for (stepLen = savStepLen, i = 0; i < bufStep; i++)
00322       {
00323          if (stepLen) // are there still bytes to write ?
00324          {
00325             *pLogBuf++ = isprint(*pCurBuf) ? *pCurBuf : '.';
00326             pCurBuf++, stepLen--;
00327          }
00328 //       else
00329 //          *pLogBuf++ = ' '; // no more data bytes
00330       }
00331       *pLogBuf = 0; // final binary zero
00332 
00333       // now writes the line
00334       fputs(logBuf, fpLog);
00335       fputc('\n', fpLog);
00336       fflush(fpLog);
00337 
00338       // checks to see if it was the last line
00339       if (savStepLen != bufStep)
00340          break;
00341 
00342       // now advances data buffer
00343       pBuf += bufStep;
00344    } // for
00345 
00346    mutex_unlock(logMutex);
00347 }

00349 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00350 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00351 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00352 
00353 /** Starts writing a Log line.
00354 
00355     @param [in]
00356     _sourceID : 3-chars string identifying the current source file
00357 
00358     @param [in]
00359     lineNum : line number in the source file where this function was called
00360 
00361     @param [in]
00362     level : severity of the Log record, see Log.h.
00363 
00364     @memberof Log
00365 */
00366 
00367 TC2API FormatFunc log_header(cchar* _sourceID, int lineNum, uint level)
00368 {
00369    // checks to see if the log facility is not initialized
00370    if (!fpLog)
00371       log_init();
00372 
00373    // doesn't write if severity not allowed (bigger level is less severity)
00374    if (level > currentLogLevel)
00375       return nullLog;
00376 
00377    assert(_sourceID);
00378 
00379    mutex_lock(logMutex); // see unlock in log_body function
00380 
00381    funcName = 0; // here we won't write the fucntion name
00382 
00383    return writeCommonHeader(_sourceID, lineNum, level);
00384 }

00386 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00387 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00388 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00389 
00390 /** Initializes the Log class.
00391 
00392     Initialization of the log facility: opens the log file and creates the
00393     contention mutex.
00394 
00395     @memberof Log
00396 */
00397 
00398 TC2API void log_init(void)
00399 {
00400    // checks to see if the log facility is already initialized
00401    if (fpLog)
00402       return;
00403 
00404    logMutex = mutex_create();
00405 
00406    if (!*logName)
00407       createLogName();
00408 
00409    fpLog = fopen(logName,"a");
00410    assert(fpLog);
00411 
00412    {
00413       char buf[20];
00414       time_formatCurrentDate(buf);
00415       log_info("******** start of execution in DD/MM/YYYY=%s ********", buf);
00416       log_info("TC2 Generic TCP Client Application Library version %s",
00417          TC2_VERSION);
00418    }
00419 }

00425 /** Set the directory where the Log file will be created.
00426 
00427     @param [in]
00428     dir : directory name where to write the Log file
00429 
00430     @memberof Log
00431 */
00432 
00433 TC2API void log_setDir(cchar* dir)
00434 {
00435    strncpy(logDir, dir, LOGDIRSIZE);
00436 }
00437 
00438 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00439 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00440 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00441 
00442 /** Set the new Log level.
00443 
00444     @param [in]
00445     newLevel : new Log level.
00446 
00447     @memberof Log
00448 */
00449 
00450 TC2API void log_setLevel(uint newLevel)
00451 {
00452    log_func(log_setLevel);
00453 
00454    if (!newLevel)
00455       newLevel = LOG_LEVEL_INFO;
00456 
00457    if (newLevel < LOG_LEVEL_INFO)
00458       log_fwarn("ignoring invalid level: %d", newLevel);
00459    else
00460    {
00461       currentLogLevel = newLevel;
00462       log_finfo("new log level: %d", newLevel);
00463    }
00464 }

00466 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00467 // INTERNAL HELPER FUNCTIONS
00468 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00469 
00470 /** Creates the Log file name.
00471 
00472     The Log file name is in the format YYMMDD_HHMMSS_pid.tse, where YYMMDD is
00473     the current date, HHMMSS is the current time, and <i>pid</i> is the current
00474     process identification provided by the operating system.
00475 
00476     @private @memberof Log
00477 */
00478 
00479 static void createLogName(void)
00480 {
00481    char * name;
00482    uint logDirSize = strlen(logDir);
00483 
00484    assert(logDirSize + 30 < LOGNAMESIZE);
00485 
00486    strcpy(logName, logDir);
00487    logName[logDirSize++] = '/';
00488    name = logName + logDirSize;
00489 
00490    // 0....5....1...*         (assuming max 30 chars)
00491    // YYMMDD_HHMMSS_pid.tse
00492    time_formatCurrentShortDateReversePacked(name);
00493    name[6] = '_';
00494    time_formatCurrentTimePacked(name+7);
00495    sprintf(name+13,"_%d.tse",thread_pid());
00496 }
00497 
00498 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00499 
00500 /** Returns the high 4 bits of a byte, formatted as an hexadecimal character.
00501 
00502     @param [in]
00503     b : the byte
00504 
00505     @return
00506     the high 4 bits of a byte, formatted as an hexadecimal character
00507 
00508     @private @memberof Log
00509 */
00510 
00511 static char hiHex(char b)
00512 {
00513    char c = ((b >> 4) & 0x0F) + 0x30;
00514    return (c > 0x39 ? (c+7) : c);
00515 }
00516 
00517 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00518 
00519 /** Maps the numeric log level to an indicator letter.
00520 
00521     @param [in]
00522     level : level number to be mapped to a letter.
00523 
00524     @return
00525     the letter corresponding to the numeric Log level
00526 
00527     @private @memberof Log
00528 */
00529 
00530 static char levelChar(uint level)
00531 {
00532    if (level == LOG_LEVEL_FATAL)
00533       return 'F';
00534 
00535    if (level == LOG_LEVEL_ERROR)
00536       return 'E';
00537 
00538    if (level == LOG_LEVEL_WARN)
00539       return 'W';
00540 
00541    if (level == LOG_LEVEL_INFO)
00542       return 'I';
00543 
00544    if (level == LOG_LEVEL_DEBUG)
00545       return 'D';
00546 
00547    if (level == LOG_LEVEL_TRACE)
00548       return 'T';
00549 
00550    return '?';
00551 }
00552 
00553 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00554 
00555 /** Returns the low 4 bits of a byte, formatted as an hexadecimal character.
00556 
00557     @param [in]
00558     b : the byte
00559 
00560     @return
00561     the low 4 bits of a byte, formatted as an hexadecimal character
00562 
00563     @private @memberof Log
00564 */
00565 
00566 static char loHex(char b)
00567 {
00568    char c = (b & 0x0F) + 0x30;
00569    return (c > 0x39 ? (c+7) : c);
00570 }
00571 
00572 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00573 
00574 /** Starts writing a Log line, common part.
00575 
00576     @param [in]
00577     _sourceID : 3-chars string identifying the current source file
00578 
00579     @param [in]
00580     lineNum : line number in the source file where this function was called
00581 
00582     @param [in]
00583     level : severity of the Log record, see Log.h.
00584 
00585     @remarks
00586     this function runs protected by the Log mutex
00587    
00588     @private @memberof Log
00589 */
00590 
00591 static FormatFunc writeCommonHeader(cchar* _sourceID, int lineNum, uint level)
00592 {
00593    // nothing special here, just formats the header of the log record
00594 
00595    time_formatCurrentTimePacked(logBuf+LOG_OFF_TIME); // without the ':'s
00596    logBuf[LOG_OFF_SPC1] = ' '; // gets rid of '\0' before
00597 
00598    logBuf[LOG_OFF_LEVEL] = levelChar(level);
00599    logBuf[LOG_OFF_SPC2] = ' ';
00600 
00601    memcpy(logBuf+LOG_OFF_SRC_ID, _sourceID, 3);
00602    logBuf[LOG_OFF_SPC3] = ' ';
00603 
00604    sprintf(logBuf+LOG_OFF_LINE, "%04d", lineNum);
00605    logBuf[LOG_OFF_SPC4] = ' ';
00606 
00607    sprintf(logBuf+LOG_OFF_THRD, "%03d", thread_selfSeqNo());
00608    logBuf[LOG_OFF_SPC5] = ' ';
00609 
00610    // return the function which will write the record body
00611    return log_body;
00612 }
00613 
00614 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00615 
00616 /** Writes the title of a trace block.
00617 
00618     @param [in]
00619     _sourceID : 3-chars string identifying the current source file
00620 
00621     @param [in]
00622     lineNum : line number in the source file where this function was called
00623 
00624     @param [in]
00625     msg : a message identifying the hex trace
00626 
00627     @param [in]
00628     bufLen : length of the trace source buffer, for information purpose
00629    
00630     @private @memberof Log
00631 */
00632 
00633 static void writeTraceTitle(cchar* _sourceID, int lineNum, cchar* msg,
00634    uint bufLen)
00635 {
00636    if (!msg) // no message ?
00637       return;
00638 
00639    writeCommonHeader(_sourceID, lineNum, LOG_LEVEL_TRACE);
00640    sprintf(logBuf + LOG_OFF_DATA, "trace: %d bytes (%s)", bufLen, msg);
00641    fputs(logBuf, fpLog);
00642    fputc('\n', fpLog);
00643    fflush(fpLog);
00644 }
